result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery M Scruton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$10,000) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined at a restitution hearing to be held within 60 days. Hearing to be requested in writing by Attorney Mann within 30 days.

Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

No contact with C. or C. Schultz and/or R. or C. Ross directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.  Defendant is prohibited from marketing any products on-line unless authorized by supervising agent.

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 1:29 p.m. Defendant Jeffery M Scruton in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI received by all parties. Atty Mann raises one clarification to be addressed in the PSI - Winnebago County has dismissed the pending case is their jurisdiction. Atty Mann will address any other concerns during sentencing argument. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Victims present in the courtroom. DA Blader agreement between the parties that restitution amount to be held in abeyance at this time as there are still other issues pending in Waupaca County. The court understands that restitution will be held in abeyance. Atty Mann to submit a written request for a restitution hearing within 30 days. If no hearing is requested, the amount submitted will be ordered in 60 days. Statement by victim. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Mann. Statement by DE.

Court orders: Cts 1 - 5 - 5 yr term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH -  18 month IC/42 month ES - concurrent to each other - No CFTS. ES Conditions: Restitution in an amount to be determined - hearing to be requested by Atty Mann within 30 days, NC w/ C. or C. Schultz and/or R. or C. Ross, No marketing of any product on-line unless authorized by supervising agent, Costs - Costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. Defendant is eligible for SAP. Defendant is not eligible for CIP. Ct 11 - S/W 2 yr probation - Consecutive to Cts 1 - 5, same terms as ES sentence.  Appeal rights given.
From Attorney Mann with Medical information for court's review prior to sentencing.
Restitution Summary - $4732.26
R.R.
C.S.
Still Shots from a Video Surveillance Camera provided by the State
Sentencing hearing on February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

14CF57 & 14CM175 Cases called @ 3:31 p.m.  Defendant Jeffery M Scruton in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 11 to Receiving Stolen Property in Excess of $10,000 - PTAC contrary to Wis Stat 943.34(1)(c).  Plea: Cts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 11 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 14CF57: Cts 6-10 - DRI. 14CM175: Cts 1 & 2 - DRI. The parties are requesting a PSI which the court orders.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on December 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mann requests a plea hearing be set.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on October 22, 2014 at 01:55 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mann requests further status in 30 days. Progress has been made but no resolution yet reached.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2014 at 01:55 pm.
Status conference on September 17, 2014 at 02:20 pm.

2014CF000057 and 2014CM000175 - Both Cases Called @ 10:57 AM: Defendant Jeffery M Scruton in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Argument by Atty Mann as to motion to amend bond ask the Court to allow Internet commerce to be able to continue.  Court recites terms of bond requirements and what was to be the Court's intent and the concerns over conducting commerce not under his own identity.  Commerce activity allowed under his own name.  Limitations were also placed upon the marketing of certain products that were manufactured in a manner that had given State rise to concerns over copyright issues and Harley Davidson.  Commentary offered by DA - based upon investigation being undertaken by Det. Olson the bond conditions were well crafted based upon the State's concerns about possible liquidation of any potential evidence.  Commentary offered by Atty Mann - Believes that internet commerce being allowed to continue under "A Name" would address the State's concerns.  The Court: Finds the provisions previously imposed as appropriate.  These cases are to be accelerated toward trial.  The Court believes it is appropriate in light of what is alleged in complaint and input from Det. Olson at the previous hearing.  Bond requirements to continue and respectfully declines any amendment.  The Court wants this case moving along to trial at an aggressive rate.  Atty Mann requests one more STC.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 02:20 pm.
Motion hearing on August 13, 2014 at 11:00 am.
to Modify Bond
State's
Status conference on July 21, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on August 19, 2014 at 09:15 am.

BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2014CF000057 AND 2014CM000175.  Defendant is permitted to engage in commerce over internet or any electronic medium exclusive to transacting business in his own name, exclusively limited to the marketing of products manufactured by VSS Manufacturing specifically a Rest Tool.  Not permitted to market any Rest Tool product in the Harley Davidson font.

14CF-57 and 14CM-175 - Both Cases Called @ 9:30 AM: Defendant Jeffery M Scruton in court with attorney Ronald K Colwell.   Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Argument as to Bond Review by Atty Colwell as to bond modificaiton.  Argument by DA Blader.  Further Argument  by Atty Colwell.  Defendant explains nature of business and Pay Pal Accounts that were terminated.  14CF-57:  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed - ARGN to proceed.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered as to each charge - 11 Cts of INFO.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 09:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2014 at 09:15 am.

records.addlTxt: 14CF57 and 14CM175 - Both Cases Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Jeffery M Scruton in court, in person, with attorney Ronald K Colwell, appearing via telephone.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  14CF57    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. 14CM175:  Complaint Stated - Advdised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Def confirms receipt of 2nd Complaint, DA serves another copy on Def.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits only as to 14CF57.  14CM175 - NGP received and entered.  DA argues as to signature bond with conditions.  Defense Counsel argues as to bond.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 09:05 am.
